Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2011 03:59AM maedmarion wrote: thank you for replying flash, I know that I am lucky to have been referred so promptly .have read of some peoples experiences on here and wept for them. I guess that I am hyper sensitive - if the rest of my life was great then I'd maybe cope better, but it's a battleground, work, relationship, trying to pay the rent, I just feel as though I don't have any strength left to fight this fight, if I have to. If I can't work I'll lose my home, and I have only just moved here........my previous landlord sold the house I was renting and so its cost me a lot to move again after only 18 months. I have no savings or other source of income. My divorce was a battle as my ex is an alcoholic - and my job is wearing out women 20 years my junior..........and the man I love is drifting away from me, although he tries hard to pretend that he isn't.............I feel broken......mind, body heart and soul. And scared that life may be about to get even harder than I have ever imagined...........
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2011 04:04AM maedmarion wrote: Thanks Luan, I'm so sorry to hear that your doctor made such a mistake - the system here is a bit different I think - you have to have had an accident or have a very serious emergency to go to ER (we call it A&E here) - they'd call up my notes and tell me to go away till Thursday as I am not on the face of it, ill or had an accident. Idon't have a lump to find, just this redness and pain with slight swelling............ thanks though, I appreciate your kindness in replying and I wish you well
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

I find that I am just exhausted all the time, though, since I knew that I was referred, so I didn't stay out for long. Feeling very tired and a bit drained now, but another day is nearly over and I have got through it with the help of all of you on here.  thank you so much. Love and prayers to you and all of the lovely ladies here

Posts.Content: Apr 26, 2011 10:22PM maedmarion wrote: hi Lisa - thanks for this - its Wednesday am here and I am feelling quite ill with fear - trying tokeep it uder control but I'm very tearful and not able to concentrate much - was feeling so low that I didn't go into work yesterday, so have got to get in there today.  Thank you for your thoughts and prayers - I really need them. I'll keep you posted.
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 09:21AM maedmarion wrote: hi Lisa - I keep crying out to God in my pain, but he doesnt hear me or help me. The stress and strain of 'the waiting room' with this following on immediately has left me weak...barely able to sleep, eat or function and my tears are unending but bring no relief. It is truly a loss - the most devastating loss I have ever sustained - please pray for me. I need Gods help here if I am to make it through.  I have not seen wonderfullymade on here since she has had her results - do you know anything? I sent her a private email, but have heard nothing back and that was yesterday. thank you for caring Lisa, please keep me in your prayersxx
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2011 07:52AM maedmarion wrote: hello my dear new friends - I have returned from the BC clinic with a clean bill of health - thank God. Just a couple of cysts, no symptoms that might suggest IBC - been mammogrammed, ulatrasounded, palpated and questioned and luckily saw the top consultant - so I am devoutly thankful that on this occasion I have been spared, but I know that some of you are fighting your battles and I am with you. I'm going to keep popping in here to see how you are all doing...........wonderfullymade - we're waititng that biopsy result on Friday. I go away on Saturday for a week, and don't have internet there but when I'm back I'll be here..............sending every one of you my thanks, my love and my prayers for your return to good health and strength. Sending hugs and kisses to you all. Marion xxxx
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

Posts.Content: maedmarion wrote: hello everyone - your posts have been such a comfort to me today.There are so many gutsy wonderful women out there - and the love and caring just floes out from the posts..... I'm really beside myself with fear - I don't have a history of BC but 16 months ago I had a recall from a routine mammogram - 24 hours of fear and imagination making it feel like a week.........but luckily the repeat mammogram and subsequent ultrasound found nothing more than cysts - black holes the radiographer called them - no treatment required and I was discharged to return for my next regular 3 year check. Since then I have had intermittent pain in both breasts, mostly the left one and recently swapped wearing bras for support tops, as the bras were getting so uncomfortable - they'd be ok first thing in the morning but by lunchtime they were tight and my breasts felt as though they'd swollen. Things are better with the support tops although my shape isn't as great - I'm a 38FF so they take some supporting, however its worth it not to get that painfull constricted feeling every day. Aweek or so ago I noticed that my left breast was hurting more frequently and I glanced at it one morning and thought that I must have lain on my hot water bottle as the top of the breast was really red - not really painful though. Anywaym I was in the throes of moving house - manically busy, plus supporting my middle son through a relationship break up, as well as working full time, so you hardly notice your body when you're so drained in every way, do you?  Over the last week or so the left breast got more sore and hot and felt tense and painful when I touched it, plus it looked blotchy red all down the left side  - so on Tuesday I went to my doctor who gave me antiviotics and did an immediate referral to the local Breast Clinic - she said don't worry its only precautionary because of the heat and redness but of course I googled the symptoms and have been crazy with fear ever since - I had never even heard of IBC before and now I'm terrified that I have it.............there's no nipple inversion, or itching and the swelling and redness  has lessened a bit since I started the medicine, I think - but as I haven't had a fever don't see how it can be an infection - am about half way though the 7 day course.  I am so hoping that my symptoms may be due to the fluid filled cysts swelling up but I have no experience of this so the IBC fear has the upper hand - I can't sleep or eat properly and I have wept buckets - don't know how to get through till Thursday - we have free healthcare here in the UK, but I have no sick pay at work ( we get 13 days per year and I used mine due to a kidney infection) and no insurance to pay my salary if I'm ill, so there are huge financial implications as well as all the physical and emotional ones........ please can anyone give me some advice and make me feel less alone?  thank you so much xx marion xx Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2011 03:46AM maedmarion wrote: Lisa thank you for your comforting words - I am in tears reading the replies I have had here, because you are all so kind..........tomorrow is a Bank Holiday, so the Clinic isn't open and I have to work Tuesday and Wednesday, somehow - there have been staff changes at our office and I can't just not go in, however I'm feeling. I had another sleepless night last night and am beginning to feel really spaced out and shaky - my left breast still looks mottled, more so than the right one - and there is still a pain - like I used to get when I wore a boned bra - kind of into my armpit as though a bra bone is pushing into the bit of my breast under my arm - can't find any glands up though, just the pain and slight redness -I'm so pale skinned that the redness shows up a lot.  Took me ages to get out of bed this morning, I so want to sleep all this away and I can't,....a couple of hours is the best I can do and then I'm awake in the dark on my own - it's a frightening time. Thank you so much for your blessings and support Lisa, I'll keep posting and reading yours others posts - makes me feel less alone.
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2011 11:38AM maedmarion wrote: oh, wonderfullymade, here you are comforting me when you are going through things still, yourself, I shall be thinking of your courage and your compassion for others whilst I'm at my appointment tomorrow and again on Friday....hoping that you will let us all know how you get on. I am so sorry that you are in pain and I'm sending gentle hugs to enfold you. Theres nothing else that we need so much when things are bad, is there? My 21 year old son lives with me and he hugs me when I cry, Thank God for those who love us and care for us. I'll be here tomorrow to let you know the outcome and next step for me. I hope to have an early night tonight, with the Rescue Remedy close to hand. Take care wonderfullymade, you're a special woman. xxx
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2011 07:20AM maedmarion wrote: you know, I was reading your posts to WeeSee yesterday and thought what a lovely lady - and here you are replying to me, thank you so much. I'll try to stay on top of things and not panic, but its hard (as you know) I'm up one minute and in the depths the next - I've seen it called 'the waiting room' on here and so I know that many many women have been in my position for one reason or another. The hugs are so gratefully received and much needed I can tell you. I'll try to be positive and not to assume the worst...........thanks again for your sweet reply
Posts.Title: Could I have IBC? So scared.......can anyone help, please? maedmarion Lisa1962

I managed to force myself out of the house today for the first time since Thursday, probably better for it, being away from the four walls does distract a bit, but I am so exhausted with all the emotion that Easter is coming and going unnoticed really. I hope that you are doing well and that you have found the kindness on here that I am finding. thanks.......

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 12:13AM maedmarion wrote: Lisa, thank you. He  called me two hours before he was due to be here to tell me that he wasn't coming, not then, not ever again. I have loved him with all my heart for nearly three years - he just doesn;t love me in the right way, he cares for me, but not enough to stay with me or marry me. I am trying to function but I feel nothing but pain and loss right now. thank you for contactin me Lisa, I wish you well, Too. Marion xx
